body:
Comment 3: 
Go binaries are statically linked, mostly by design, so they
contain things like the formatted print library and garbage collector,
as well as runtime type information and such.

This C program is 744kB on my Linux system, statically linked:

#include <stdio.h>

int
main(void)
{
	printf("hello, world - %g\n", 3.14);
	return 0;
}

When you consider how much more Go is doing, 1.2 MB is not terrible.

Russ
_Status changed to **Unfortunate**._
